title: Frontend Engineer
short_desc: Build interactive user interfaces for web applications.
long_desc: As a Frontend Engineer, you bridge the gap between design and technology. You spend your days writing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (React, Vue, etc.) to create responsive and accessible web interfaces. You collaborate closely with designers to ensure visual fidelity and backend developers to integrate APIs. Problem-solving involves optimizing rendering performance and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
pathway: Learn HTML/CSS/JS -> React/Angular -> Build Projects -> Junior Dev

title: Backend Engineer
short_desc: Architect server-side logic and databases.
long_desc: Backend Engineers build the engine under the hood of web applications. You design APIs, manage databases, and ensure server security and scalability. Your day involves writing logic in Python, Java, Go, or Node.js, optimizing SQL queries, and managing cloud infrastructure like AWS. It requires strong logical thinking and attention to system architecture.
pathway: Learn Language (Python/Java) -> SQL -> APIs -> Cloud Basics

title: Data Scientist
short_desc: Extract insights from complex data using math and code.
long_desc: Data Scientists combine mathematics, statistics, and programming to analyze large datasets. You build machine learning models to predict trends, automate decisions, or classify information. A typical day involves data cleaning, model training in Python/R, and visualizing results for stakeholders. It is a highly analytical role requiring deep focus.
pathway: Learn Python -> Statistics -> ML Algorithms -> Deep Learning

title: General Practitioner (Doctor)
short_desc: Diagnose and treat patients with various health issues.
long_desc: GPs are the first point of contact for patients. You diagnose illnesses, prescribe medication, and refer patients to specialists. The job requires high empathy, quick critical thinking, and a vast knowledge of human biology. Hours can be long and stressful, but the impact on community health is immense.

title: Civil Engineer
short_desc: Design and supervise infrastructure projects like roads and bridges.
long_desc: Civil Engineers plan, design, and oversee construction of infrastructure. You split time between the office (designing in CAD) and the field (inspecting sites). Math and physics are used daily to ensure structural integrity. It involves project management and dealing with environmental and safety regulations.
pathway: Degree -> Internships -> Site Engineer -> Project Manager

title: Investment Banker
short_desc: Advise companies on mergers, acquisitions, and capital raising.
long_desc: Investment Bankers help corporations and governments raise capital. It is a high-pressure, high-reward role involving financial modeling, valuation, and creating pitch decks. Expect very long working hours (60-80 hours/week) but significant compensation. You need strong numerical skills and resilience.

title: Graphic Designer
short_desc: Create visual concepts for brands and media.
long_desc: Graphic Designers communicate ideas through art and technology. You use software like Adobe Creative Suite to design logos, websites, and marketing materials. It requires a strong aesthetic sense and the ability to take client feedback. A portfolio is often more important than a degree.

title: IAS / Civil Servant
short_desc: Administer government policies and manage districts.
long_desc: Civil Servants are the backbone of government administration. Roles like IAS involve policy implementation, law and order maintenance, and disaster management. It requires cracking extremely tough competitive exams (UPSC). The job offers immense power, prestige, and job security, but frequent transfers and political pressure are common.

title: Mechanical Engineer
short_desc: Design and manufacture mechanical systems and machinery.
long_desc: Mechanical Engineers design engines, machines, and thermal devices. You work with CAD software and oversee manufacturing processes on the factory floor. It combines physics, material science, and creativity. Roles range from automotive design to HVAC systems.

title: Chartered Accountant (CA)
short_desc: Manage financial records, audits, and taxation.
long_desc: CAs are experts in accounting, auditing, and taxation. You ensure regulatory compliance for businesses and individuals. The qualification process is rigorous. The work involves deep analysis of financial sheets and interpreting tax laws. It is a stable, high-respect profession.

title: Registered Nurse
short_desc: Provide patient care and support doctors in hospitals.
long_desc: Nurses administer medication, monitor patient health, and offer emotional support. It is a physically demanding role requiring high empathy and stamina. Nurses work in shifts, including nights. It is the heart of the healthcare system with high job stability.
pathway: Nursing Degree -> Licensing Exam -> Hospital Duty

title: Corporate Lawyer
short_desc: Handle legal matters for businesses and corporations.
long_desc: Corporate lawyers advise companies on their legal rights and duties. You draft contracts, handle mergers, and ensure compliance with regulations. It involves heavy reading, negotiation, and long hours. Unlike litigators, you spend more time in boardrooms than courtrooms.
pathway: CLAT Exam -> Law School -> Bar Exam -> Law Firm

title: Architect
short_desc: Plan and design buildings and structures.
long_desc: Architects combine art and engineering. You design functional and aesthetically pleasing buildings while adhering to safety codes. The job involves sketching, using CAD software, and visiting construction sites. It requires creativity, spatial awareness, and technical knowledge.

title: School Teacher (Secondary)
short_desc: Educate students in specific subjects like Math or Science.
long_desc: Teachers prepare lesson plans, grade assignments, and manage classrooms. You shape the future of students by imparting knowledge and values. It requires patience, communication skills, and subject mastery. Holidays are a perk, but the work is demanding during term time.
pathway: Subject Degree -> B.Ed -> TET Exam -> School Job

title: Electrician
short_desc: Install and repair electrical wiring and systems.
long_desc: Electricians work with high-voltage systems in homes and factories. It is a skilled trade requiring knowledge of circuits, safety protocols, and manual dexterity. Work can be hazardous but is essential and well-paid for skilled workers. It involves travel to different sites.

title: Head Chef
short_desc: Lead a kitchen and create culinary menus.
long_desc: Chefs oversee food preparation, menu planning, and kitchen staff. It is a high-pressure, creative environment. You stand for long hours, work evenings/weekends, and must ensure hygiene and quality. Passion for food and leadership skills are essential.
pathway: Culinary School -> Commis Chef -> Sous Chef -> Head Chef

title: Commercial Pilot
short_desc: Fly aircraft to transport passengers and cargo.
long_desc: Pilots operate complex aircraft systems and navigate flights safely. It requires technical knowledge, perfect vision, and calm under pressure. The lifestyle involves constant travel and irregular hours. Training is expensive, but the career is high-status and high-paying.
pathway: Flight School -> 200 Flying Hours -> CPL Exam -> Type Rating

title: Clinical Psychologist
short_desc: Diagnose and treat mental health disorders.
long_desc: Psychologists provide therapy to help individuals cope with life challenges and mental disorders. You listen, analyze behavior, and develop treatment plans. It requires patience, empathy, and strong boundaries. You may work in hospitals, clinics, or private practice.
pathway: BA Psychology -> MA Psychology -> M.Phil -> Licensing

title: Marketing Manager
short_desc: Plan strategies to promote products and brands.
long_desc: Marketing Managers analyze market trends and run campaigns to increase sales. You coordinate with creative teams and sales departments. The role blends creativity with data analysis. Success is measured by campaign ROI and brand visibility.

title: Agricultural Scientist
short_desc: Improve farming methods and crop yields.
long_desc: Agricultural Scientists research crops, soil, and farming techniques to improve food production. You work in labs and on farms. The role is vital for food security and sustainability. It involves biology, chemistry, and fieldwork.

title: Cybersecurity Analyst
short_desc: Protect computer networks from cyber attacks.
long_desc: Cybersecurity Analysts monitor networks for security breaches and investigate violations. You install firewalls, perform penetration testing, and develop security standards. It is a constant battle against hackers requiring up-to-date technical knowledge and vigilance.
pathway: IT Degree -> Network Admin -> Security Certs (CEH/CISSP) -> Analyst

title: Police Officer
short_desc: Maintain law and order and protect the community.
long_desc: Police officers patrol areas, respond to emergencies, and investigate crimes. It is a physically and mentally demanding job with high risk. You serve the public and must adhere to strict codes of conduct. The job offers authority and a pension but involves dangerous situations.
pathway: Exam -> Physical Test -> Training Academy -> Posting

title: Fashion Designer
short_desc: Design clothing and accessories.
long_desc: Fashion Designers create sketches, select fabrics, and oversee the production of clothing lines. You need to predict trends and have a distinct artistic style. It is a highly competitive field. Success often depends on networking and portfolio quality.
pathway: Design School -> Internship -> Assistant Designer -> Launch Label

title: Pharmacist
short_desc: Dispense medications and advise on usage.
long_desc: Pharmacists ensure patients receive correct prescriptions and understand how to take them. You work in pharmacies or hospitals. Strong attention to detail is critical to prevent drug interactions. It involves customer service and chemical knowledge.

title: Journalist
short_desc: Investigate and report news stories.
long_desc: Journalists research, write, and present news for print, TV, or online media. You need a nose for news, strong writing skills, and the ability to work under tight deadlines. Ethics and objectivity are paramount. The industry is fast-paced and evolving digitally.

title: HR Manager
short_desc: Oversee recruitment and employee relations.
long_desc: HR Managers handle hiring, payroll, conflicts, and company culture. You are the bridge between management and staff. Strong interpersonal skills and knowledge of labor laws are required. It is a corporate role with regular hours.
pathway: BBA -> MBA HR -> HR Executive -> HR Manager

title: Hotel Manager
short_desc: Manage daily operations of a hotel.
long_desc: Hotel Managers ensure guests have a pleasant stay and operations run smoothly. You oversee housekeeping, front desk, and food services. It requires hospitality skills, crisis management, and working weekends/holidays.
pathway: HM Degree -> Management Trainee -> Dept Manager -> GM

title: Veterinarian
short_desc: Treat medical issues in animals.
long_desc: Vets diagnose and perform surgery on animals. You work with pets, livestock, or zoo animals. It requires a love for animals and emotional resilience (dealing with euthanasia). The path involves long study similar to human medicine.
pathway: Vet School (5 years) -> Internship -> License -> Clinic

title: Fullstack Developer
short_desc: Handle both frontend and backend development.
long_desc: Fullstack Developers can build a complete web application from scratch. You understand servers, databases, and user interfaces. It is a versatile role highly valued by startups. You need to master multiple languages and frameworks.
pathway: Learn JS -> React -> Node.js -> DBs -> Build Apps

title: UI/UX Designer
short_desc: Design intuitive and beautiful digital products.
long_desc: UI/UX Designers focus on the look and feel of apps. UX involves research and wireframing; UI involves visual design and prototyping. You use tools like Figma. Empathy for the user and an eye for aesthetics are crucial.
pathway: Learn Figma -> Build Portfolio -> Internship -> Junior Designer

title: Financial Analyst
short_desc: Analyze financial data to guide business decisions.
long_desc: Financial Analysts examine market trends and company accounts to recommend investments. You work in banks, insurance, or corporate finance. Excel modeling and data interpretation are daily tasks. It is analytical and detail-oriented.
pathway: Commerce Degree -> CFA L1 -> Analyst Job

title: Event Planner
short_desc: Organize weddings, conferences, and parties.
long_desc: Event Planners manage budgets, vendors, and logistics for events. You need organizational skills and the ability to handle stress when things go wrong. It is a social job involving travel and working weekends.

title: Automotive Mechanic
short_desc: Repair and maintain cars and vehicles.
long_desc: Mechanics diagnose engine issues and replace parts. It involves manual labor, grease, and technical knowledge of engines. Modern mechanics also use diagnostic computers. It is a stable trade with opportunities to own a garage.

title: Personal Trainer
short_desc: Guide clients in exercise and nutrition.
long_desc: Trainers help clients achieve fitness goals through workout plans. You need to be fit, motivating, and knowledgeable about anatomy. Hours are flexible but often include early mornings or evenings. It is a high-energy, social job.

title: Army Officer
short_desc: Lead soldiers and protect national security.
long_desc: Army Officers command units in the armed forces. It requires peak physical fitness, discipline, and leadership. You face dangerous situations and live a regimented life. The career offers honor, adventure, and lifetime benefits.

title: Interior Designer
short_desc: Plan and decorate indoor spaces.
long_desc: Interior Designers make spaces functional and beautiful. You select furniture, colors, and lighting. It involves client meetings, sourcing materials, and project management. You need a portfolio and knowledge of design software.

title: Game Developer
short_desc: Code and create video games.
long_desc: Game Developers build the logic and physics of video games. You work with engines like Unity or Unreal and languages like C++ or C#. It is a dream job for gamers but involves long hours ('crunch') near deadlines.
pathway: Learn C++/C# -> Unity/Unreal -> Build Portfolio -> Studio Job

title: University Professor
short_desc: Teach advanced subjects and conduct research.
long_desc: Professors lecture university students and publish academic research. It requires a PhD and deep expertise. You have academic freedom but face pressure to publish. It is a prestigious, intellectual career.
pathway: Master's -> PhD -> Research Papers -> Assistant Professor

title: Cabin Crew / Flight Attendant
short_desc: Ensure passenger safety and comfort on flights.
long_desc: Cabin Crew manage in-flight services and safety procedures. You travel the world but deal with jet lag and difficult passengers. Grooming and communication are key. It is a customer-facing role with strict requirements.

title: Biotechnologist
short_desc: Use biology to create products and medicines.
long_desc: Biotechnologists research genetics, microbes, and cells to solve problems. You work in labs developing vaccines, biofuels, or GMO crops. It combines biology and technology. It is research-intensive.

title: Content Writer
short_desc: Write articles, blogs, and copy for the web.
long_desc: Content Writers create engaging text for websites and marketing. You need excellent grammar and SEO knowledge. It offers great flexibility and freelance potential. You research diverse topics daily.

title: Dentist
short_desc: Treat teeth and oral health issues.
long_desc: Dentists perform procedures like fillings, root canals, and extractions. You need manual dexterity and medical knowledge. Private practice offers high income potential. It is less stressful than emergency medicine but physically tiring.

title: Petroleum Engineer
short_desc: Design methods to extract oil and gas.
long_desc: Petroleum Engineers work on finding and extracting energy resources. It is one of the highest-paying engineering fields but involves working in remote locations or offshore rigs. It requires strong geology and physics knowledge.

title: Social Worker
short_desc: Support vulnerable individuals and communities.
long_desc: Social Workers help people cope with poverty, abuse, or addiction. You connect them to resources and provide counseling. It is emotionally taxing but highly meaningful. You work for NGOs or the government.

title: Merchant Navy Officer
short_desc: Operate commercial ships and transport cargo.
long_desc: Merchant Navy officers navigate ships across oceans. You stay at sea for months, earning tax-free income. It requires physical toughness and technical skills. Life is isolated but adventurous.

title: Supply Chain Manager
short_desc: Manage the flow of goods from source to consumer.
long_desc: Supply Chain Managers optimize logistics, inventory, and transport. You analyze data to cut costs and speed up delivery. It involves negotiation and process management. Critical for retail and manufacturing.

title: Physiotherapist
short_desc: Help patients recover movement and manage pain.
long_desc: Physiotherapists use exercise and massage to treat injuries. You work with athletes, elderly, or accident victims. It is a physical job requiring anatomical knowledge. You can work in hospitals or run a clinic.

title: Animator
short_desc: Create moving images for movies and games.
long_desc: Animators bring characters to life using software like Maya or Blender. You need artistic skill and technical patience. It involves frame-by-frame attention to detail. Work is often project-based in studios.

title: Nutritionist / Dietitian
short_desc: Advise people on healthy eating and diet.
long_desc: Nutritionists create diet plans to improve health or manage diseases. You understand the chemistry of food and human biology. You can work in hospitals, gyms, or freelance. Empathy and communication are key.

title: Translator / Interpreter
short_desc: Convert text or speech from one language to another.
long_desc: Translators work with documents; Interpreters work with spoken language. You need fluency in at least two languages and cultural understanding. Opportunities exist in diplomacy, business, and literature.

title: Product Manager
short_desc: Guide the success of a product and lead teams.
long_desc: PMs sit at the intersection of tech, business, and UX. You decide what features to build and why. You influence teams without direct authority. It requires strategic thinking and communication.

title: Welder
short_desc: Fuse metals together in construction and manufacturing.
long_desc: Welders use heat to join metal parts. It is a highly skilled trade used in construction, automotive, and aerospace. It requires hand-eye coordination and safety awareness. Underwater welding is a niche, high-pay option.

title: Film Director
short_desc: Lead the creative vision of a movie or video.
long_desc: Directors control the artistic and dramatic aspects of a film. You guide actors and technical crew. It is highly competitive and requires vision, leadership, and storytelling ability. Work is project-based.
pathway: Film School -> Short Films -> Assistant Director -> Director

title: Landscape Architect
short_desc: Design outdoor spaces like parks and gardens.
long_desc: Landscape Architects plan natural environments. You combine botany, design, and ecology. You work with plants and hardscapes (paths, fountains). It involves both office design and site visits.

title: Ethical Hacker (Pentester)
short_desc: Hack systems legally to find weaknesses.
long_desc: Ethical Hackers are hired to break into networks to fix security flaws. You use the same tools as cybercriminals but for good. It requires deep technical knowledge and curiosity. Certification is key.

title: Actuary
short_desc: Calculate financial risk using math and statistics.
long_desc: Actuaries work in insurance and finance to predict risk and set premiums. It involves complex mathematics and probability. You must pass a series of difficult exams while working. It is highly paid and stable.

title: Radiologist
short_desc: Diagnose disease using X-rays and imaging.
long_desc: Radiologists are doctors who interpret medical images (MRI, CT, X-ray). You identify injuries and diseases. It is technology-heavy and less patient-facing than other medical roles. Requires long study.

title: Aerospace Engineer
short_desc: Design aircraft and spacecraft.
long_desc: Aerospace Engineers develop flight technology. You work on aerodynamics, propulsion, and avionics. It is a high-tech field requiring physics and math. You often work for defense or space agencies.

title: Sound Engineer
short_desc: Record and mix sound for music and film.
long_desc: Sound Engineers handle the technical aspects of audio. You operate mixing desks in studios or live venues. It requires a good ear and technical knowledge of acoustics and software. Work can be late nights.

title: Geologist
short_desc: Study the earth's structure and resources.
long_desc: Geologists examine rocks and soil to find minerals or understand earth history. You split time between labs and remote field locations. It is essential for mining and environmental protection.

title: Librarian
short_desc: Manage information and help people find books.
long_desc: Librarians organize collections and assist researchers. Modern librarians also manage digital databases. It is a quiet, service-oriented role requiring organization and love for information. Often requires a specific master's degree.

title: Plumber
short_desc: Install and repair water and gas piping systems.
long_desc: Plumbers interpret blueprints and work with tools to install pipes, fixtures, and appliances. It requires physical stamina, problem-solving skills for leak detection, and knowledge of building codes. It is a recession-proof trade with high independent earning potential.

title: Carpenter
short_desc: Construct and repair building frameworks and structures from wood.
long_desc: Carpenters measure, cut, and shape wood and other materials. You work on construction sites or in workshops creating furniture, frames, or cabinets. It requires mathematical precision for measurements and hand dexterity.

title: DevOps Engineer
short_desc: Bridge software development and IT operations.
long_desc: DevOps Engineers automate the process of testing and releasing software. You use tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and Jenkins to ensure code runs smoothly on servers. It requires knowledge of both coding and infrastructure.

title: Paramedic / EMT
short_desc: Provide emergency medical care in critical situations.
long_desc: Paramedics are the first responders to 911/emergency calls. You treat injuries, cardiac arrests, and trauma in an ambulance. It requires nerves of steel, quick thinking, and physical strength. The work is high-stress but life-saving.

title: Sales Representative
short_desc: Sell products or services to customers.
long_desc: Sales Reps identify leads, pitch products, and close deals. You need excellent communication, resilience against rejection, and negotiation skills. Earnings are often commission-based, rewarding high performers.

title: Air Traffic Controller
short_desc: Direct aircraft traffic on the ground and in the air.
long_desc: ATCs ensure planes maintain safe distances. You watch radar and communicate with pilots. It is famous for being one of the most stressful yet highest-paying jobs requiring no degree (just intense training). Focus must be absolute.

title: Professional Photographer
short_desc: Capture images for art, media, or events.
long_desc: Photographers use cameras and lighting to create visual stories. You edit photos using software like Lightroom. Niches range from weddings to wildlife. It requires an artistic eye and self-marketing skills.

title: Biomedical Engineer
short_desc: Design medical equipment and devices.
long_desc: Biomedical Engineers combine engineering with biology to create pacemakers, prosthetics, and imaging machines. You work in R&D labs or hospitals. It is a bridge between technical design and patient care.

title: Firefighter
short_desc: Extinguish fires and rescue people in danger.
long_desc: Firefighters respond to fire alarms and accidents. It requires extreme physical fitness, courage, and teamwork. You work 24-hour shifts at stations. The job is hazardous but commands high community respect.

title: Mobile App Developer
short_desc: Create applications for Android and iOS.
long_desc: Mobile Developers build apps for smartphones using Swift (iOS), Kotlin (Android), or Flutter. You focus on performance and touch interfaces. The market is huge, with opportunities in every industry.
pathway: Learn Java/Swift -> Build Apps -> Publish to Store -> Job

title: Marine Biologist
short_desc: Study ocean life and ecosystems.
long_desc: Marine Biologists research sea creatures and ocean health. You spend time on boats, diving, and in labs. Conservation is a big part of the role. It is a niche scientific field requiring passion for the sea.

title: Stock Trader
short_desc: Buy and sell stocks to profit from market fluctuations.
long_desc: Traders analyze market data to make quick buy/sell decisions. It can be done for a firm or independently. High risk and high stress, but potentially massive rewards. Requires emotional control and math skills.
pathway: Learn Technical Analysis -> Paper Trade -> Live Trade

title: Makeup Artist
short_desc: Apply makeup for fashion, film, or events.
long_desc: MUAs transform appearances using cosmetics. You work with brides, models, or actors. It requires artistic skill, hygiene knowledge, and networking. Work is often freelance and involves travel.

title: Public Relations (PR) Specialist
short_desc: Manage the public image of a person or company.
long_desc: PR Specialists write press releases and manage media relations. You handle crises and shape public perception. It requires excellent writing and social skills. Networking with journalists is key.

title: QA Engineer (Tester)
short_desc: Test software to find bugs before release.
long_desc: Quality Assurance Engineers run manual and automated tests on software. You document bugs and work with developers to fix them. It requires attention to detail and patience. A great entry point into tech.

title: Real Estate Agent
short_desc: Help clients buy, sell, and rent properties.
long_desc: Real Estate Agents show properties, negotiate prices, and handle paperwork. You need to know the local market and be available on weekends. Income is commission-based, so sales skills are vital.
pathway: Join Agency -> Build Network -> Close Deals

title: Video Editor
short_desc: Edit raw footage into polished videos.
long_desc: Video Editors tell stories by cutting and assembling clips. You use Premiere Pro or Davinci Resolve. YouTube and streaming have exploded demand for this role. It requires a sense of timing and visual rhythm.

title: Forensic Scientist
short_desc: Analyze evidence from crime scenes.
long_desc: Forensic Scientists examine DNA, fingerprints, and substances to solve crimes. You work in labs and testify in court. It requires strict adherence to procedure and a strong stomach for crime details.

title: Flight Instructor
short_desc: Teach students how to fly aircraft.
long_desc: Flight Instructors build hours and experience by teaching new pilots. You need patience and perfect knowledge of aviation rules. It is often a stepping stone to becoming an airline pilot.
pathway: CPL -> Instructor Rating -> Flying School Job

title: Economist
short_desc: Research trends in the economy.
long_desc: Economists analyze data on employment, inflation, and interest rates. You advise governments or banks on policy. It involves heavy statistics and writing reports. A master's or PhD is usually required.

title: HVAC Technician
short_desc: Install and repair heating and cooling systems.
long_desc: HVAC techs work on air conditioners and heaters. It involves electrical and mechanical skills. Demand is high due to climate control needs. You travel to homes and businesses.

title: Astronomer
short_desc: Study the universe, stars, and planets.
long_desc: Astronomers use telescopes and computer models to understand the cosmos. It is a pure research role requiring advanced physics and math. Jobs are mostly in academia or government agencies.

title: Pastry Chef
short_desc: Specialize in making desserts and baked goods.
long_desc: Pastry Chefs focus on cakes, chocolates, and bread. It requires precision (baking is chemistry) and artistic decoration skills. You often work early mornings.
pathway: Culinary School -> Bakery Internship -> Pastry Chef

title: Occupational Therapist
short_desc: Help people improve daily living skills.
long_desc: OTs help patients with disabilities perform tasks like dressing or cooking. You adapt their environment to their needs. It is distinct from physiotherapy as it focuses on function rather than movement.

title: Technical Writer
short_desc: Write manuals and guides for complex products.
long_desc: Technical Writers simplify complex information for users. You write manuals for software or machinery. It requires understanding technology and clear writing skills.

title: Yoga Instructor
short_desc: Teach yoga postures and breathing techniques.
long_desc: Yoga Instructors guide classes in physical and mental wellness. You need flexibility, calmness, and knowledge of anatomy. It is often a freelance or part-time career with a focus on holistic health.

title: Robotics Engineer
short_desc: Build and program robots.
long_desc: Robotics Engineers combine mechanics, electronics, and coding. You build automated machines for factories or exploration. It is a cutting-edge field requiring diverse engineering skills.

title: Environmental Scientist
short_desc: Protect the environment and human health.
long_desc: Environmental Scientists identify pollution and develop solutions. You work on policy, cleanups, and sustainability. It involves field sampling and lab analysis.

title: Bank Branch Manager
short_desc: Oversee the operations of a bank branch.
long_desc: Branch Managers lead the staff and ensure sales targets are met. You deal with high-value clients and operational compliance. It is a responsible role with good job security.
pathway: PO Exam/MBA -> Assistant Manager -> Branch Manager

title: Mining Engineer
short_desc: Plan and supervise mine extraction.
long_desc: Mining Engineers ensure minerals are extracted safely and efficiently. You work in remote locations, often underground or in open pits. It requires geological knowledge and heavy machinery management.

title: Art Director
short_desc: Guide the visual style of magazines, product packaging, or movies.
long_desc: Art Directors manage design teams to execute a creative vision. You don't just design; you decide the mood and style. Common in advertising and publishing.

title: Database Administrator (DBA)
short_desc: Secure and organize data using software.
long_desc: DBAs ensure data is available, safe from hackers, and easy to access. You manage backups and performance tuning. It is a critical backend role.

title: Landscape Gardener
short_desc: Maintain gardens and outdoor grounds.
long_desc: Gardeners plant, trim, and water vegetation. It involves working outdoors with nature. It requires knowledge of plants and physical effort.

title: Sound Designer
short_desc: Create sound effects for games and movies.
long_desc: Sound Designers create the audio atmosphere. You record custom sounds or synthesize them. It is crucial for immersion in entertainment.

title: Archivist
short_desc: Preserve historical documents and records.
long_desc: Archivists evaluate and store valuable records for the future. You work in museums or government archives. It requires history knowledge and organization.

title: Speech Therapist
short_desc: Treat speech and communication disorders.
long_desc: SLPs help children and adults overcome stuttering or voice issues. You work in schools or clinics. It requires linguistics knowledge and patience.

title: Sports Coach
short_desc: Train athletes and teams for competition.
long_desc: Coaches develop strategy and training regimens. You motivate players and manage team dynamics. Experience in the sport is mandatory.

title: Geneticist
short_desc: Study genes and heredity.
long_desc: Geneticists research DNA to understand diseases or traits. You work in labs with advanced equipment. Key for medicine and agriculture.

title: Insurance Underwriter
short_desc: Evaluate risk to decide on insurance applications.
long_desc: Underwriters use data to decide if someone should get insurance and at what cost. It is an analytical desk job.

title: Urban Planner
short_desc: Plan the development of cities and towns.
long_desc: Urban Planners decide where roads, parks, and houses go. You analyze population growth and zoning laws. Requires vision and civic sense.

title: Nanotechnologist
short_desc: Manipulate matter at the atomic scale.
long_desc: Nanotechnologists develop materials atom by atom. You create stronger metals, better drug delivery systems, or faster chips. It is cutting-edge science requiring physics and chemistry.

title: Perfumer
short_desc: Create scents and fragrances.
long_desc: Perfumers (or 'Noses') blend chemicals and natural oils to create smells for perfumes or soaps. You need an exceptional sense of smell and knowledge of chemistry.

title: Land Surveyor
short_desc: Measure land boundaries and geography.
long_desc: Surveyors use GPS and theodolites to map land for construction or legal borders. You work outdoors in all terrains. Precision is critical for property laws.

title: Crane Operator
short_desc: Operate heavy cranes at construction sites.
long_desc: Crane Operators lift steel and concrete to great heights. It requires excellent depth perception, steady hands, and safety focus. It is one of the highest-paid construction trades.

title: Museum Curator
short_desc: Manage collections of art or history.
long_desc: Curators decide what a museum displays. You acquire items, research their history, and plan exhibitions. It requires deep academic knowledge and organizational skills.

title: Mediator
short_desc: Resolve conflicts between people outside court.
long_desc: Mediators help divorcing couples or business partners reach agreements. You remain neutral and facilitate communication. It is less adversarial than being a lawyer.

title: Botanist
short_desc: Study plants and ecosystems.
long_desc: Botanists research plant life, from moss to redwoods. You might discover new species or improve crops. Work is split between the outdoors and the laboratory.

title: Sports Agent
short_desc: Manage careers and contracts for athletes.
long_desc: Sports Agents negotiate salaries and endorsements for players. You need legal knowledge, sales skills, and a love for sports. It is high-pressure and competitive.

title: Horologist (Watchmaker)
short_desc: Repair and build mechanical watches.
long_desc: Watchmakers work with microscopic gears and springs. It requires incredible patience, steady hands, and focus. It is a dying art with high demand for luxury repair.

title: Stunt Performer
short_desc: Perform dangerous actions for movies.
long_desc: Stunt Performers jump from buildings, drive fast cars, or fight on camera. You take the risks for the actors. It requires peak fitness and specialized training (driving, fighting).

title: Costume Designer
short_desc: Design outfits for characters in films/plays.
long_desc: Costume Designers create the 'look' of a character through clothes. You research history, source fabrics, and supervise fittings. It blends fashion and storytelling.

title: IT Support Specialist
short_desc: Help people fix computer problems.
long_desc: IT Support fixes login issues, installs software, and repairs hardware. It is the entry point into the tech world. You need patience and problem-solving skills.

title: Cloud Architect
short_desc: Design cloud computing strategies.
long_desc: Cloud Architects plan how companies use AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. You ensure systems are scalable and secure. It is a senior, high-paying tech role.
pathway: Dev/SysAdmin -> Solutions Architect Cert -> Cloud Architect

title: AI Ethicist
short_desc: Ensure Artificial Intelligence is safe and fair.
long_desc: AI Ethicists study the moral implications of algorithms. You check for bias in AI and create guidelines for responsible use. It requires a mix of tech and philosophy.

title: Adventure Guide
short_desc: Lead tourists on treks, rafts, or climbs.
long_desc: Adventure Guides take clients into the wild. You ensure safety while providing a thrilling experience. You need first aid skills, fitness, and local knowledge.

title: Veterinary Technician
short_desc: Nurse animals and assist veterinarians.
long_desc: Vet Techs draw blood, give shots, and prep animals for surgery. It is like being a nurse but for pets. It is physically active and emotionally demanding.

title: Medical Transcriptionist
short_desc: Type out doctor's voice notes.
long_desc: Transcriptionists listen to audio recordings of doctors and type them into reports. You need fast typing and knowledge of medical terms. It is often a work-from-home job.

title: Career Counselor
short_desc: Help people find their perfect job.
long_desc: Career Counselors assess client skills and interests to guide them. You help with resumes, interview prep, and life direction. Empathy and market knowledge are key.

title: Elevator Mechanic
short_desc: Install and fix elevators and escalators.
long_desc: Elevator Mechanics keep lifts running safely. It involves electronics, hydraulics, and working in tight shafts. It is one of the highest-paying trade jobs due to the risk and skill.

title: Fundraiser
short_desc: Raise money for charities and non-profits.
long_desc: Fundraisers build relationships with donors to secure money for causes. You host events, write grant proposals, and network. It is sales but for a social cause.

title: CNC Machinist
short_desc: Program machines to cut metal parts.
long_desc: CNC Machinists use computer-controlled tools to create precision metal parts for cars or planes. You need to read blueprints and write code (G-code).

title: Digital Forensics Analyst
short_desc: Recover data from computers for investigations.
long_desc: Analysts find deleted files or traces of hacking on devices. You help solve cybercrimes. It requires deep knowledge of operating systems and file structures.

title: Hydrologist
short_desc: Study how water moves across the earth.
long_desc: Hydrologists solve water quality and supply problems. You check river levels and pollution. It is critical for managing droughts and floods.

title: Auctioneer
short_desc: Sell items to the highest bidder.
long_desc: Auctioneers manage sales of art, cars, or houses. You need a fast speaking voice ('the chant') and the ability to read a crowd. It is high-energy sales.

title: Arborist
short_desc: Care for and climb trees.
long_desc: Arborists (Tree Surgeons) prune or remove dangerous trees. You use ropes and chainsaws at great heights. It is physically demanding conservation work.

title: Textile Designer
short_desc: Create patterns for fabrics.
long_desc: Textile Designers draw patterns for clothes, carpets, and upholstery. You understand weaving, printing, and fibers. You work with fashion brands or home decor.

title: Technical Recruiter
short_desc: Find and hire tech talent.
long_desc: Tech Recruiters hunt for software engineers for companies. You need to understand tech terms to interview candidates. It is a sales-heavy HR role.

title: Art Therapist
short_desc: Use art to help people heal mentally.
long_desc: Art Therapists use painting or drawing to help patients express emotions. You work in hospitals or schools. It combines psychology and fine arts.

title: Locksmith
short_desc: Install and repair locks.
long_desc: Locksmiths help people who are locked out or install security systems. You need mechanical skills and trustworthiness. It is an emergency-driven trade.

title: Sustainability Consultant
short_desc: Help companies become eco-friendly.
long_desc: Consultants analyze a company's carbon footprint and suggest changes. You work on energy efficiency and waste reduction. It is a corporate role for green advocates.

title: Oceanographer
short_desc: Study physical and biological aspects of oceans.
long_desc: Oceanographers study currents, waves, and marine ecosystems. It involves computer modeling and deep-sea expeditions. Essential for climate change research.

title: Public Health Worker
short_desc: Promote health in communities.
long_desc: PHWs organize vaccination drives and hygiene awareness campaigns. You work with government bodies to prevent disease. It requires empathy and organizational skills.

title: Sports Journalist
short_desc: Report on sports news and matches.
long_desc: Sports Journalists cover games, interview athletes, and write analyses. You need deep sports knowledge and fast writing skills. Work involves weekends and travel.

title: Video Game Tester
short_desc: Play games to find glitches and bugs.
long_desc: Game Testers play developmental versions of games repeatedly to break them. It is repetitive and requires detailed reporting, not just 'playing for fun'.

title: Technical Trainer
short_desc: Teach employees how to use software or machinery.
long_desc: Trainers conduct workshops to upgrade employee skills. You need to master the tech and have teaching ability. Corporate training is a lucrative niche.

title: Solar Sales Consultant
short_desc: Sell solar power systems to homeowners.
long_desc: Consultants explain the benefits of green energy and close deals. It is a direct sales role with high commission potential. You need persuasion skills.

title: Wind Energy Engineer
short_desc: Design wind farms and turbines.
long_desc: Engineers plan the layout and technology of wind power plants. You use aerodynamics and electrical knowledge. It involves site analysis and technical design.

title: Urban Gardener
short_desc: Create green spaces in cities.
long_desc: Urban Gardeners design rooftop gardens and vertical walls. You help cool cities and grow food locally. It combines horticulture with urban design.

title: Bicycle Mechanic
short_desc: Repair and build bicycles.
long_desc: Bike Mechanics fix gears, brakes, and frames. As cycling grows for fitness and transport, skilled mechanics are in demand. It is tactile and mechanical work.

title: Personal Shopper
short_desc: Buy clothes and gifts for clients.
long_desc: Personal Shoppers help busy people find the right items. You need good taste and organizational skills. You work for stores or independently.

title: Voice Actor
short_desc: Provide voices for animations and ads.
long_desc: Voice Actors use their voice to act without being seen. You record for audiobooks, cartoons, or commercials. You need vocal control and a home studio.

title: Museum Conservator
short_desc: Restore and protect old artifacts.
long_desc: Conservators use chemistry and art skills to fix damaged paintings or statues. It requires extreme patience and scientific knowledge. You preserve history.

title: Data Analyst (Health)
short_desc: Analyze health data to improve care.
long_desc: Health Data Analysts work with hospitals to improve patient outcomes using numbers. You track disease trends and operational efficiency.

title: Food Technologist
short_desc: Ensure food safety and develop new products.
long_desc: Food Technologists work in factories to make food safe and tasty. You check quality and invent new flavors. It involves chemistry and regulation.

title: Packaging Designer
short_desc: Design boxes and wrappers for products.
long_desc: Packaging Designers create the box your phone or cereal comes in. You mix graphic design with structural engineering (folding). It is key for branding.

title: Stage Manager
short_desc: Coordinate live theatre and events.
long_desc: Stage Managers run the show behind the scenes. You cue lights, sound, and actors. It requires leadership and calm under pressure during live performances.

title: Lighting Technician
short_desc: Set up lights for concerts and film.
long_desc: Lighting Techs rig and operate lights to create mood. You work on movie sets or live stages. It is technical and physically active work.

title: Demolition Expert
short_desc: Safely destroy buildings.
long_desc: Demolition Experts use explosives or heavy machinery to bring down structures. You calculate physics to ensure safety. It is dangerous and precise work.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator
short_desc: Manage medical drug trials.
long_desc: CRCs ensure clinical trials follow rules. You recruit patients and collect data for new medicines. You work with doctors and pharmaceutical companies.

title: Zookeeper
short_desc: Feed and care for zoo animals.
long_desc: Zookeepers clean enclosures and feed wildlife. You monitor animal health and educate the public. It is hard physical work but rewarding for animal lovers.

title: UI/UX Researcher
short_desc: Studies user behavior to improve product usability and design decisions.
long_desc: UI/UX Researchers focus on understanding how users interact with digital products. A typical day includes conducting interviews, usability testing, analyzing user journeys, and collaborating with designers and product managers. They transform qualitative and quantitative data into actionable insights that guide design decisions. The role requires empathy, analytical thinking, and strong communication skills to advocate for user-centered design within organizations.
pathway: Learn UX fundamentals → Conduct research projects → Join product teams

title: Technical Writer
short_desc: Creates clear documentation for technical products and software.
long_desc: Technical Writers translate complex technical concepts into clear, concise documentation. Their work includes writing user guides, API docs, tutorials, and internal documentation. They collaborate with engineers and product teams to ensure accuracy. Strong language skills, attention to detail, and the ability to understand technical systems are essential.
pathway: Learn documentation tools → Build samples → Join tech teams

title: Supply Chain Analyst
short_desc: Optimizes logistics, inventory, and supply chain operations.
long_desc: Supply Chain Analysts analyze data related to procurement, inventory, and logistics to improve efficiency. Daily tasks include forecasting demand, evaluating suppliers, and reducing costs. The role blends analytics, operations knowledge, and business strategy, often working cross-functionally with operations and finance teams.
pathway: Operations fundamentals → Analytics tools → Supply chain roles

title: Environmental Scientist
short_desc: Studies environmental issues and develops sustainability solutions.
long_desc: Environmental Scientists analyze environmental data to assess risks and design conservation strategies. Their work involves field research, data analysis, and policy recommendations. They often collaborate with government agencies, NGOs, and research institutions to address climate change and pollution.
pathway: Study environmental science → Research projects → Professional roles

title: Educational Consultant
short_desc: Advises students and institutions on academic planning and careers.
long_desc: Educational Consultants guide students in choosing academic paths and institutions. They assess interests, aptitude, and goals to provide personalized recommendations. The role requires counseling skills, educational knowledge, and strong interpersonal abilities.
pathway: Education knowledge → Counseling skills → Consulting roles

title: Cloud Solutions Architect
short_desc: Designs scalable and secure cloud infrastructure for organizations.
long_desc: Cloud Solutions Architects design and manage cloud-based systems that support business applications. A typical day includes evaluating system requirements, designing cloud architectures, ensuring security compliance, and guiding development teams. They work closely with stakeholders to migrate legacy systems to the cloud and optimize performance and cost.
pathway: Learn cloud platforms → Gain infra experience → Architect roles

title: QA Automation Engineer
short_desc: Ensures software quality through automated testing systems.
long_desc: QA Automation Engineers design automated tests to validate software functionality and performance. They collaborate with developers to catch defects early and maintain reliable release cycles. The role requires programming skills, testing frameworks knowledge, and attention to detail.
pathway: Learn testing basics → Automation tools → QA roles

title: Game Designer
short_desc: Designs gameplay mechanics, stories, and player experiences.
long_desc: Game Designers create engaging game concepts, mechanics, and narratives. They collaborate with developers and artists to balance gameplay, test mechanics, and refine player experience. Creativity, logic, and understanding player psychology are essential.
pathway: Learn game tools → Build portfolio → Studio roles

title: Biotech Research Assistant
short_desc: Supports laboratory research in biotechnology and life sciences.
long_desc: Biotech Research Assistants conduct experiments, collect data, and support scientists in laboratory environments. Daily tasks include sample preparation, data recording, and maintaining lab equipment. The role requires scientific curiosity, precision, and adherence to safety standards.
pathway: Biotech degree → Lab experience → Research roles

title: Policy Analyst
short_desc: Evaluates public policies and provides data-driven recommendations.
long_desc: Policy Analysts research, analyze, and evaluate government and organizational policies. Their work involves data analysis, report writing, and advising policymakers. Strong analytical skills and understanding of social systems are crucial.
pathway: Policy studies → Research roles → Advisory positions

title: Product Marketing Manager
short_desc: Bridges product development and market positioning.
long_desc: Product Marketing Managers define product messaging, positioning, and go-to-market strategies. They work closely with product, sales, and marketing teams to ensure products meet customer needs. Analytical thinking and communication skills are essential.
pathway: Marketing basics → Product exposure → PMM roles

title: Data Engineer
short_desc: Builds and maintains systems for large-scale data processing.
long_desc: Data Engineers design data pipelines, databases, and processing systems that enable analytics and machine learning. They collaborate with data scientists and analysts to ensure data availability and reliability. Strong programming and system design skills are required.

title: Social Media Analyst
short_desc: Analyzes social media data to improve digital engagement strategies.
long_desc: Social Media Analysts track and analyze performance metrics across social platforms. They provide insights to optimize content strategies and audience engagement. The role blends creativity with data analysis.
pathway: Social platforms → Analytics tools → Strategy roles

title: Robotics Engineer
short_desc: Designs and develops robotic systems and automation solutions.
long_desc: Robotics Engineers work on designing, building, and programming robotic systems. They integrate hardware and software to automate tasks across industries. Strong engineering fundamentals and problem-solving skills are essential.
pathway: Engineering basics → Robotics projects → Industry roles

title: Urban Planner
short_desc: Plans and designs land use and infrastructure for cities.
long_desc: Urban Planners develop plans for land use, transportation, and public spaces. They balance environmental, social, and economic factors while collaborating with government and communities. The role requires analytical thinking and public engagement skills.

title: Financial Risk Analyst
short_desc: Assesses financial risks to help organizations make informed decisions.
long_desc: Financial Risk Analysts evaluate market, credit, and operational risks. They use quantitative models and financial data to guide investment and compliance strategies. Strong analytical and financial skills are required.
pathway: Finance fundamentals → Risk models → Analyst roles

title: Instructional Designer
short_desc: Designs effective learning experiences and educational content.
long_desc: Instructional Designers create structured learning programs for schools and corporate training. They apply learning theory, multimedia, and assessment strategies to improve learning outcomes.
pathway: Learning theory → Content tools → Design roles

title: Energy Analyst
short_desc: Analyzes energy systems, markets, and sustainability solutions.
long_desc: Energy Analysts study energy consumption, renewable systems, and market trends. They provide insights to optimize energy use and support sustainability initiatives. Analytical and environmental knowledge is key.

title: Digital Forensics Analyst
short_desc: Investigates cyber incidents and digital evidence.
long_desc: Digital Forensics Analysts collect and analyze digital evidence to investigate cyber crimes and security breaches. They work with law enforcement and security teams, requiring strong technical and investigative skills.
pathway: Security basics → Forensics tools → Analyst roles

title: Healthcare Administrator
short_desc: Manages operations and administration of healthcare facilities.
long_desc: Healthcare Administrators oversee daily operations of hospitals, clinics, and healthcare organizations. Their responsibilities include managing staff, budgets, compliance, and patient services. The role blends management skills with knowledge of healthcare systems and regulations.
pathway: Healthcare studies → Management training → Admin roles

title: DevOps Engineer
short_desc: Automates and optimizes software development and deployment processes.
long_desc: DevOps Engineers bridge development and operations teams by automating infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, and monitoring systems. Their work ensures faster releases, system reliability, and scalable deployments. Strong scripting, cloud, and collaboration skills are essential.

title: Actuary
short_desc: Uses mathematics and statistics to assess financial risks.
long_desc: Actuaries analyze statistical data to evaluate risk in insurance, finance, and pensions. They build predictive models and advise organizations on minimizing financial uncertainty. The role demands strong mathematical ability and long-term analytical thinking.
pathway: Math degree → Actuarial exams → Analyst roles

title: Aviation Operations Manager
short_desc: Oversees airline or airport operations and logistics.
long_desc: Aviation Operations Managers coordinate flight operations, ground services, safety compliance, and logistics. They ensure efficient and safe functioning of aviation services. The role requires operational planning and regulatory knowledge.
pathway: Aviation studies → Ops experience → Manager roles

title: CSR Manager
short_desc: Leads corporate social responsibility initiatives and impact programs.
long_desc: CSR Managers design and manage social responsibility programs, sustainability initiatives, and community engagement efforts. They align business goals with social impact, requiring communication and ethical leadership skills.
pathway: Social work → Corporate programs → CSR leadership

title: Telecommunications Engineer
short_desc: Designs and maintains communication systems and networks.
long_desc: Telecommunications Engineers work on designing and maintaining systems that enable voice and data communication. They ensure network reliability, upgrade infrastructure, and troubleshoot issues. Technical expertise in networks is critical.
pathway: Electronics basics → Network systems → Telecom roles

title: Investment Banker
short_desc: Advises organizations on mergers, acquisitions, and capital raising.
long_desc: Investment Bankers work with corporations to manage financial transactions such as mergers, acquisitions, and IPOs. The role involves financial modeling, market analysis, and client communication. High-pressure environments and long hours are common.
pathway: Finance degree → Analyst roles → Banking positions

title: Content Strategist
short_desc: Plans and manages content strategies for brands and platforms.
long_desc: Content Strategists develop long-term content plans aligned with business goals. They analyze audience needs, oversee content creation, and optimize distribution. Strong storytelling and strategic thinking are key.

title: Logistics Manager
short_desc: Manages transportation, warehousing, and supply logistics.
long_desc: Logistics Managers coordinate movement of goods, manage warehouses, and optimize delivery routes. The role involves operational planning, vendor coordination, and cost control.

title: Clinical Data Manager
short_desc: Manages and validates clinical research data.
long_desc: Clinical Data Managers oversee data collection, validation, and analysis for clinical trials. They ensure accuracy, compliance, and integrity of research data. The role combines healthcare knowledge with data management skills.
pathway: Clinical studies → Data systems → Manager roles

title: Technical Recruiter
short_desc: Sources and hires technical talent for organizations.
long_desc: Technical Recruiters identify, evaluate, and hire technical professionals. They collaborate with hiring managers, screen candidates, and manage recruitment pipelines. Communication and understanding of technical roles are key.
pathway: HR basics → Tech hiring → Recruiter roles

title: Geospatial Analyst
short_desc: Analyzes geographic and spatial data for decision-making.
long_desc: Geospatial Analysts work with GIS tools and spatial datasets to analyze geographic patterns. Their work supports urban planning, environmental analysis, and logistics decisions. Strong analytical and technical skills are required.
pathway: GIS tools → Spatial analysis → Analyst roles

title: Research Program Manager
short_desc: Manages large-scale research initiatives and collaborations.
long_desc: Research Program Managers coordinate research projects, funding, timelines, and stakeholders. They bridge scientists, institutions, and sponsors to ensure research goals are met efficiently.

title: Agri-Business Manager
short_desc: Manages agricultural businesses and supply chains.
long_desc: Agri-Business Managers oversee agricultural production, supply chains, and marketing. They combine business management with agricultural knowledge to improve efficiency and profitability.

title: Materials Scientist
short_desc: Studies and develops new materials for industrial and technological use.
long_desc: Materials Scientists research the properties of metals, polymers, ceramics, and composites to develop improved materials. Their work supports industries such as electronics, aerospace, and energy. The role involves laboratory experiments, data analysis, and collaboration with engineers.
pathway: Science degree → Lab research → Industry roles

title: Sustainability Consultant
short_desc: Advises organizations on sustainability and environmental impact.
long_desc: Sustainability Consultants help organizations reduce environmental impact and meet sustainability goals. They analyze operations, assess risks, and design sustainability strategies. The role requires analytical thinking and environmental knowledge.
pathway: Sustainability studies → Consulting projects → Advisor roles

title: Public Relations Manager
short_desc: Manages brand reputation and public communications.
long_desc: Public Relations Managers handle media relations, crisis communication, and brand messaging. They shape public perception through press releases, campaigns, and stakeholder engagement. Strong communication skills are essential.

title: Industrial Designer
short_desc: Designs products combining aesthetics, usability, and manufacturing.
long_desc: Industrial Designers create physical products such as consumer goods and devices. They work on concept development, prototyping, and user testing. Creativity and technical understanding are crucial.

title: Bioinformatics Analyst
short_desc: Analyzes biological data using computational methods.
long_desc: Bioinformatics Analysts combine biology and computer science to analyze genomic and biological datasets. They support medical research, drug discovery, and diagnostics through data-driven insights.
pathway: Biology + coding → Data analysis → Research roles

title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist
short_desc: Ensures products comply with regulations and standards.
long_desc: Regulatory Affairs Specialists manage compliance with government regulations in healthcare, pharma, and manufacturing. They prepare documentation, liaise with regulators, and ensure product approvals.

title: Behavioral Scientist
short_desc: Studies human behavior to inform policy, design, and strategy.
long_desc: Behavioral Scientists apply psychology and data analysis to understand decision-making. Their insights inform product design, public policy, and organizational strategy. Strong research skills are required.

title: Marine Engineer
short_desc: Designs and maintains mechanical systems of ships and vessels.
long_desc: Marine Engineers work on propulsion, power systems, and machinery aboard ships. They ensure operational safety and efficiency. The role requires engineering expertise and willingness to work at sea.
pathway: Marine studies → Sea experience → Senior roles

title: Quality & Compliance Manager
short_desc: Ensures products and processes meet quality standards.
long_desc: Quality & Compliance Managers design quality systems, conduct audits, and ensure regulatory compliance. They work across manufacturing and service industries to maintain standards and reduce risk.

title: Sports Analytics Specialist
short_desc: Uses data to improve sports performance and strategy.
long_desc: Sports Analytics Specialists analyze performance metrics, player data, and game strategies. Their insights support coaching decisions and team optimization. The role blends sports knowledge with data analytics.
pathway: Analytics skills → Sports domain → Team roles

title: Disaster Management Specialist
short_desc: Plans and manages disaster preparedness and response.
long_desc: Disaster Management Specialists develop response plans, coordinate emergency services, and manage relief operations. The role involves high responsibility and public service commitment.
pathway: Public service training → Field roles → Leadership

title: Heritage Conservationist
short_desc: Preserves and restores cultural and historical heritage.
long_desc: Heritage Conservationists work on preserving monuments, artifacts, and cultural sites. They combine research, fieldwork, and restoration techniques to protect heritage for future generations.
pathway: Heritage studies → Field projects → Specialist roles

title: Technical Product Owner
short_desc: Owns product requirements and bridges business with engineering.
long_desc: Technical Product Owners manage product backlogs, define requirements, and work closely with engineering teams. They ensure technical feasibility aligns with business goals.

title: Waste Management Consultant
short_desc: Advises organizations on waste reduction and recycling strategies.
long_desc: Waste Management Consultants analyze waste systems and recommend sustainable disposal and recycling solutions. They work with industries and municipalities to reduce environmental impact.
pathway: Env studies → Consulting projects → Advisor roles
